about_the_game:
As a solo indie developer, everything lies in your hands: Adding features, editing the levels and trying to make the best game you can. Each attempt is different and gives you the chance to build the next big indie hit. Choose the perfect music, add better art and manage the expectations of your parents. The reviews will judge you in any case. It's all about The Games You Make.

Make good choices

Jetpacks or jump scares? Why not both! Choose between spending time on combining new exciting features, much needed fixes or tending to your social life. Every choice you make will be reflected in the resulting game. Turn that weird bug into a feature or work on the perfect beginning of the level. Follow up with that artist from last week’s meetup to get more visual oomph.

Success and failure will determine the next set of features to unlock which in turn might give you the edge you’ve been looking for in the next title.

Make a game, for real

The level editor provides you with all the tools to create a game, and it's up to you to design the best version possible. Ensure it remains playable; the reviews will let you know what they think about your masterpiece.

Make friends

While you are working on your game, life happens around you. Whoever you choose to spend time with might open the door to funding, new features or just mental support. Take care of yourself and your friends. Your curiosity might be rewarded.

Key Features

  • Intuitive level-editor: Share your levels with other players

  • Deck-like discovery: Add new gameplay to your growing repertoire, discover more hidden features everywhere

  • Creative Freedom: Combine features in surprising ways and build unique gameplay twists

  • Contextual Narration: Friends and family accompany you on your journey. Will they support you or drive you mad?

Minimum:
  • OS: SteamOS 3 or newer
  • Processor: Quad-core 2.5 Ghz CPU or better
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA RTX-2000 series or newer, AMD RX-6000 series or newer
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

short_description: “Quit your job, take out a loan and make a top seller game” sounded like a great idea two months ago. Now, you’re chasing bizarre bugs, combining features that should never go together, and striving to capture that mysterious thing called “fun”. Every decision is yours—and so are the consequences.
